comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Looks like William Jennings Bryan and Woodrow Wilson.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Bryan supported Wilson in the 1912 election and was rewarded with a Cabinet position. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Jennings_Bryan

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: lifeasdaddy:  Thanks, it looks like you are correct. We will add your identifications to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: They are standing on the steps of the main entrance of the New Jersey State Capitol buildng, in Trenton, New Jersey. Bryan visited Wilson in Trenton, and Wilson visited Bryan in Lincoln, Nebraska, where they went to church together (Presbyterian). The polished granite columns of the Capitol entrance portico, on Flickr: www.flickr.com/photos/jamiedfw/743381614/

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
